definition: variant of 眷[juan4]/to care about/to look fondly on
to inject/to pour into/to concentrate/to pay attention/stake (gambling)/classifier for sums of money/variant of 註|注[zhu4]

sentences.english: I hope you got interested in the request.
sentences.chinese: 同时希望您眷注我的哀告。

sentences.english: The love and care you have given us will encourage us to go through a long and arduous journey.
sentences.chinese: 您给以我们的爱和眷注将激昂着我们走过艰巨困苦。

sentences.english: Many people choose to live in overseas, which has turned on greto concern.
sentences.chinese: 许多人选择住在番邦，这引起了极大的眷注。

sentences.english: To say, the city's development is closely related with the Expo.
sentences.chinese: 说来，这个都市的开展，与世博会亦是彼此眷注。

sentences.english: How should we like it were stars to burn.
sentences.chinese: 倘若群星燃烧着眷注我们的激情。

sentences.english: Your thoughtfulness has given me great joy, miu miu handbags.
sentences.chinese: 你的体贴眷注给了我宏大的快慰。

sentences.english: I care just around people and I know the importance of insurance.
sentences.chinese: 我眷注他人，我知道安全的严重性。

sentences.english: As a teacher, he always cares about his students.
sentences.chinese: 始终眷注着自己的学生。

sentences.english: You'll get more attention from your partner, and you know you certainly deserve it.
sentences.chinese: 会获得伴侣的更多眷注，会知道这些都是应得的。

sentences.english: The sharpie remark on the marble mark in the market is remarkably craple.
sentences.chinese: 骗子关于市场上大理石象征的评论值得眷注。

definition: to draw water/(fig.) to promote sb to a more senior position
to depend ultimately on (Tw)/absolutely reliant on
